title: Benefits of vertical farming
description: Vertical farming offers a compelling solution to the social and economic challenges faced by traditional agriculture

title: Reliable year-round crop production
description: It goes without saying that traditional farms need fertile arable land. But vertical farms can be designed and built in any climate or location - irrespective of weather conditions or temperature extremes.

title: Unaffected by adverse weather conditions
description: Depending on which crop is grown, one acre of vertical farm could consistently grow the equivalent to between 10 or 20 soil-based acres.

title: Better use of space
description: One of the main vertical farming benefits is that the Hydroponic growing process only uses about 10% of the amount of water, and as a result the nutrients and fertilisers

title: Minimise water usage
description: Vertical farming also helps to improve biodiversity because it does not cause land surface disturbance, which helps the natural animal population which lives in and around farms to thrive.

title: No chemicals or pesticides
description: Growing food in a vertical farm, when managed correctly offers the opportunity to completely eliminates the need for pesticides - as pests cannot enter the controlled environment to cause crop damage
